MVCF.ModDef.label: Half-Life Mod
MVCF.ModDef.description: Adding animal ranged attacks for Half-Life creatures

ThingDef.label: bullsquid
ThingDef.description: Bullsquids (taxonomic designation: Gastropolypus toxophlegmata, or "Phlegm-shooting Many-legged-mouth") are a species of highly aggressive, bipedal creatures that appear throughout the Black Mesa Research Facility during the Resonance Cascade. Bullsquids are able to survive, if not thrive, in environments that are unfriendly or even toxic to humans, including sewers and pools of radioactive chemicals or biological waste

ThingDef.label: houndeye
ThingDef.description: The Houndeye (taxonomic designation: Sonicanis myriops, or "Many-eyed Sound Dog") is a tripedal creature that teleported to Earth from Xen after the Resonance Cascade. Possessing only three legs and a thorax, the Houndeye is a faint yellow-green in color, with electric blue tiger-like stripes adorning its spine. In place of a head there is a large, black, insect-like compound eye protected by vertical eyelids.

DamageDef.label: sonic blast
DamageDef.deathMessage: {0} has died in a sonic blast.

ThingDef.label: antlion soldier
ThingDef.description: Antlions are social creatures living in large underground colonies. They are blind and use pheromones and vibrations to identify other living beings. They come in several types, some of which are separate castes. \n \n Antlion Soldiers are the most visible element of Antlion society, most of which is kept hidden in fiercely defended underground nests.

ThingDef.label: antlion worker
ThingDef.description:
Antlions are social creatures living in large underground colonies. They are blind and use pheromones and vibrations to identify other living beings. They come in several types, some of which are separate castes. 
 
 The Antlion Worker is a four-legged insectoid creature with a termite-like head, and standing round 3 to 5 feet in height and 6 feet in length. Like other Antlion castes, their legs are arranged oddly, with their back legs set at their front, and vice versa, walking with four legs. Antlion Workers occupy the same role as Ant workers and Termite workers do on Earth, likely performing labor within their colonies. 
 They are capable of expelling an acidic compound at high velocity and usethis ability offensively when possible.

ThingDef.label: antlion guard
ThingDef.description: The Antlion Guards (also called Myrmidonts by Vortigaunts) are a much larger and robust variant of the Antlion Soldier, and are a very formidable foe. Within the Antlion society, the Guards defend the Antlion nests' outer perimeter and entrances, and they keep order within the Antlion colony.

ThingDef.label: antlion grub
ThingDef.description: The antlion grubs resemble Earthly insect larvae, with soft, translucent bodies and underdeveloped limbs. They also have small mouths that open and close slowly. They emit a high chirping call and bioluminescence similar to that of a Firefly.

ThingDef.label: antlion mound
ThingDef.description: A mound built by antlions that serves as an exit from their many underground nests. If disturbed it will start periodically spawning antlions.

ThingDef.label: headcrab
ThingDef.description: Headcrabs are alien parasitoids, roughly the size of a pumpkin. They are covered in smooth skin, which varies in color between subspecies, and walks on four short legs. These provide enough jumping power to leap up to 3 meters (10 feet) in any direction, albeit still requiring a direct line of visual contact between the Headcrab and its target before it can leap forwards, placing Headcrabs in a horrible position if the leap attack were to miss, requiring it to do a turn at a disadvantageously slow speed with its tiny legs. \n Headcrabs are blind and detect their prey by sound and ground vibration, seemingly unhindered by lack of sight.

ThingDef.label: fast headcrab
ThingDef.description:
Headcrabs are alien parasitoids, roughly the size of a pumpkin. They are covered in smooth skin, which varies in color between subspecies, and walks on four short legs. These provide enough jumping power to leap up to 3 meters (10 feet) in any direction, albeit still requiring a direct line of visual contact between the Headcrab and its target before it can leap forwards, placing Headcrabs in a horrible position if the leap attack were to miss, requiring it to do a turn at a disadvantageously slow speed with its tiny legs. 
 Headcrabs are blind and detect their prey by sound and ground vibration, seemingly unhindered by lack of sight. 
 
 This subspecies is much faster and can close the distance at lightning speed, but otherwise is less resilient than the standard variant.

ThingDef.label: poison headcrab
ThingDef.description:
Headcrabs are alien parasitoids, roughly the size of a pumpkin. They are covered in smooth skin, which varies in color between subspecies, and walks on four short legs. These provide enough jumping power to leap up to 3 meters (10 feet) in any direction, albeit still requiring a direct line of visual contact between the Headcrab and its target before it can leap forwards, placing Headcrabs in a horrible position if the leap attack were to miss, requiring it to do a turn at a disadvantageously slow speed with its tiny legs. 
 Headcrabs are blind and detect their prey by sound and ground vibration, seemingly unhindered by lack of sight. 
 
 This subspecies uses its poison fangs to deliver deadly neurotoxin to its target but is slower than the other two subspecies.

ThingDef.label: reviver headcrab
ThingDef.description: The reviver headcrab, sometimes referred to as the "lightning dog" is not actually related to standard headcrabs at all. Themain similarities being their size and parasitic nature. However, the revivers ability to take over a host body is completely different and, unfortunately, poorly understood. They are capable of discharging a blob of electrified fluid at its target to stun them and deal minor damage.

ThingDef.label: gonarch
ThingDef.description: The Gonarch is the final phase of the Headcrab's life-cycle. Little is known about how and when the metamorphosis from Headcrab to Gonarch takes place, as few Headcrabs ever reach that stage. \n The Gonarch boasts a thick exoskeleton, powerful legs, and a large sack resembling a testicle dangling from its underbelly. It can easily withstand massive amounts of projectile and explosive damage. \n When disturbed it will start spawning headcrabs at a rapid rate, so prepare to fight a swarm if you plan to engage one.

ThingDef.label: gargantua
ThingDef.description: The Gargantua is approximately six meters (20 feet) tall, mostly blue in color, and has one yellow eye that glows red when it perceives a hostile unit. \n In place of hands, it sports two pincer-like appendages resembling mussels that can be opened to emit jets of intense heat, as well as secondary "de-evolving" legs below the trunk, a common trait in most Xen creatures.\n The creature has a thick carapace that renders it almost completely bulletproof, and requires a large amount of explosive, electrical, or energy damage before being destroyed.
